item.title: Testing week for US bond investors
item.description: US bond investors are braced for a testing week, dominated by record $75bn in debt sales by the US Treasury and the Federal Reserve’s policy meeting, which concludes on Wednesday

item.title: DPJ chief hits at ‘US-led’ globalism
item.description: Yukio Hatoyama, leader of Japan's opposition Democratic party who is strongly placed favourite to be its next to become prime minister, has vowed to shield his nation's people and industries from globalisation

item.title: Germany still in credit crunch ‘danger’
item.description: The country is still at risk of a credit crunch as banks face a wave of corporate downgrades, the head of the country’s main banking association has warned

item.title: Facebook acquires FriendFeed
item.description: Facebook made its most significant acquisition to date, announcing it will buy the social sharing service FriendFeed in a move that that will fuel Facebook’s drive to enmesh itself more widely throughout the web

item.title: Strong dollar takes toll on metals groups
item.description: US stocks drifted from last week’s highs, with investors looking to bank profits even as several experts gave a relatively bullish analysis for equities

item.title: Afghanistan throws up tough choices for Obama
item.description: At a time when the US president is under acute pressure to rein in a multitrillion dollarhuge US fiscal deficit and when the Pentagon is severely overstretched, another hefty troop request would be hard to satisfy

item.title: Coffee perks up McDonald’s global sales
item.description: McDonald’s move into mochas and iced lattes has helped the fast-food chain report its seventh consecutive month of increases in global sales this year, underscoring the resilience of its business model in the recession

item.title: Ebay and GM set for online car deals
item.description: Buyers of new cars will be able to haggle with dealers over the internet under a joint venture between General Motors and Ebay

item.title: Feast and famine
item.description: Self-sufficiency is an appealing slogan in Britain, and reducing waste plain is common sense. But such prescriptions are no way to solve the global food crisis

item.title: Yanzhou close to Australian coal deal
item.description: China’s Yanzhou Coal Mining is in advanced talks to buy Felix Resources in a cash takeover bid that is expected to value the Australian coal mining group at about A$3.7bn
